column4: Anyone in here know about DD causing disks to become smaller? I dd'd an image onto a USB stick a few days back and now Windows shows the disk as being the size of the image :\
is there something I have to do?
if you're dd'ing a disk it will take the partition table of the disk the iamge was made from, which can make it "seem" smaller
how should i get it to recognise the full disk size again?
you'd have to reparition it and re-write the partition table,
just been doing some reading, but i don't understand totally -- can 'gpart' guess the right partition table or something?
it won't guess it, you need to re-write it
well, if i only want one partition that should be simple enough, right?
try it - but take a backup
that's the price of using images, it takes the configuration of the image the machine was made on
i don't have anything on the disk i need to backup
it appears after all that gpart can actually guess at partitions :|
how would i go about manually creating a partition table for it to write? it does have a -b switch to restore a backup, but i don't have one
honestly, I've never thought about that, you could dd it off
yeah but the issue is at this point in time i'm stuck with the 7mb table
